name: You Know My Voice Multiple Choice Quiz | Celebrities Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which multi-talented performer is known for his voice acting in the "Star Wars" (1977) film series where he was the voice of the character Darth Vader?
questions.explanation:
James Earl Jones.

	James Earl Jones has served as a narrator voice for many movies and television programs. He also provided the authoritative voice of Darth Vader in the original "Star Wars" trilogy. He also voiced the character of Mufasa in Disney's classic film "The Lion King" in 1994. He is one of the few performers who have won an Academy Award, a Tony Award, and a Golden Globe Award. Because of the deep resonance of his voice, it surprises many people to learn that as a child he had a severe stutter which caused him to be practically mute for many years.

questions.text: Voice actor Mel Blanc was known as the voice of which of the following cartoon characters?
questions.explanation:
Bugs Bunny.

	Many fans remember Blanc, "The Man of a Thousand Voices", as a legend at Warner Brother's Studio. He was the voice of Bugs Bunny, Yosemite Sam, Porky Pig, and Daffy Duck, just to name a few. He was the primary voice heard in most "Looney Tunes" and "Merrie Melodies" cartoons. He is quite possibly the most influential voice in the field of voice acting.

questions.text: Which well-known comedian and actor did the voice of the Genie in Disney's 1992 animated musical "Aladdin"?
questions.explanation:
Robin Williams.

	Robin Williams was one of the greatest multi-talented comedic geniuses at the turn of the 21st century. Besides voice acting the character of the Genie in the "Aladdin" movie series, he voiced the character of Pinwheeler in "Robots" (2005). His voice can be heard in "Happy Feet" (2006) where he voiced the characters of Ramon and Lovelace.

questions.text: Which of the following men voiced the character of Homer Simpson for over twenty years?
questions.explanation:
Dan Castellaneta.

	Dan Castellaneta is probably most-well known for saying "D'oh!" thousands of times during the long-running cartoon "The Simpsons" which started in 1989. He is the voice of Homer, Krusty the Clown, Mayor Quimby and Grampa Simpson. He was won four Emmy Award for his work on the show (as of 2015) and is one of the highest paid voice actors in America.

questions.text: Hank Azaria is a well-known voice actor who was the voice of Pluto for over 40 years.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The Disney character of Pluto only spoke for a short period after his creation in 1930 and has remained silent ever since. Actor Hank Azaria was not born until 1964. Alongside Dan Castellaneta, he is one of the primary voices in the television program "The Simpsons" (1989) where he is the voice of Chief Wiggum, Moe Szyslak, and the Comic Book Guy, just to name a few. His voice skills have earned him multiple Emmy Awards. He is also an actor, comedian, and movie producer.

questions.text: Wayne Allwine and his wife Russi Taylor voiced the characters of Mickey and Minnie Mouse for over twenty years.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Allwine was the voice for Mickey Mouse for 32 years until his death in 2009. His wife Russi Taylor started voicing Minnie Mouse in 1986, and was still active in the role 25 years later. Allwine took over as Mickey Mouse from Walt Disney who had provided the original voice for the previous 30 years. Russi Taylor can be heard in "Duck Tails" and occasionally in "The Simpsons".

questions.text: Tom Kenny is the primary voice actor for which of the following aquatic children's cartoons?
questions.explanation:
SpongeBob SquarePants.

	Tom Kenny's voice can be heard in many different cartoon programs, most famously as SpongeBob, in the children's cartoon "SpongeBob SquarePants" (1999). He also voices the narrator and several other characters in the series. His voice can be heard on the television show "Futurama" (1999), where he portrays the main character, Yancy Fry. Tom Kenny's voice can be heard in over 200 other children's cartoons and he has won numerous awards for his skills as a voice actor.

questions.text: Which of the following actors, who was stranded on a desert island in the 1960'\s, was also known as the voice of Mr. Magoo?
questions.explanation:
Jim Backus.

	Jim Backus was the voice of the nearsighted cartoon character Mr. Magoo for over 40 years. He worked on radio for years as well as on stage, on television and in movies. He is possibly most famous for his portrayal of Thurston Howell III in the 1960's television comedy "Gilligan's Island".

questions.text: Thurl Ravenscroft is the voice behind which of the following feline characters?
questions.explanation:
Tony the Tiger.

	Thurl Ravenscroft is the voice that has told you for years, in commercials for Kellog's Frosted Flakes, that "They're Grrrrrreat!" He is also the voice that sings the song "You're a Mean One, Mr. Grinch" on the Christmas special "How the Grinch Stole Christmas" (1966). His voice, both singing and talking, can be heard in "Sleeping Beauty" (1959), "Peter Pan"(1953), "Dumbo" (1941), and "Pinocchio" (1940), just to name a few.

questions.text: Which of the following celebrities did the voice of Shaggy Rogers, from the television program "Scooby-Doo", from 1969-1997?
questions.explanation:
Casey Kasem.

	Casey Kasem was a radio disc jockey and voice actor who provided the voice of Shaggy Rogers in the "Scooby-Doo" cartoons. His voice can also be heard in all sixty episodes of "The Transformers" voicing multiple characters during the 1980s.
